alert.note: Alert for Clarke; Washington (Alabama) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued March 22 at 7:00PM CDT until March 22 at 7:30PM CDT by NWS Mobile
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 730 PM CDT FOR NORTHEASTERN WASHINGTON AND CENTRAL CLARKE COUNTIES... At 659 PM CDT, a severe thunderstorm was located 5 miles northwest of McIntosh, or 13 miles southeast of Chatom, moving northeast at 40 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect damage to roofs, siding, and trees. Locations impacted include... Jackson, Wagarville and Leroy. TORNADO...POSSIBLE HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...<.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 700 PM CDT for southwestern Alabama. A Tornado Watch also remains in effect until 1100 PM CDT for southwestern Alabama. For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. Torrential rainfall is occurring with this storm, and may lead to flash flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
